midas/examples/basic/analyzer.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         analyzer.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     Experiment specific analyzer code (user part).
00007 
00008                 This is the "simple" version of an analyzer which
00009                 does not use any HBOOK functionality nor a module
00010                 concept.
00011 
00012                 This program can be used as a framework for user
00013                 written analyzers that don't use the CERN library.
00014 
00015   $Log: analyzer.c,v $
00016   Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/20 23:37:10  mucap
00017   Importing release 1.9.5 of the MIDAS source code as distributed by PSI.
00018   (Next, I'll commit our local customizations.)
00019 
00020   Revision 1.3  2004/01/08 08:40:08  midas
00021   Implemented standard indentation
00022 
00023   Revision 1.2  1998/10/12 12:18:58  midas
00024   Added Log tag in header
00025 
00026 
00027 \********************************************************************/
00028 
00029 #include <stdio.h>
00030 #include "midas.h"
00031 
00032 /*-- Globals -------------------------------------------------------*/
00033 
00034 /* The analyzer name (client name) as seen by other MIDAS clients   */
00035 char *analyzer_name = "Analyzer";
00036 
00037 /* analyzer_loop is called with this interval in ms (0 to disable)  */
00038 INT analyzer_loop_period = 0;
00039 
00040 /*-- Function declarations -----------------------------------------*/
00041 
00042 INT analyze_trigger_event(char *);
00043 INT analyze_scaler_event(char *);
00044 
00045 /*-- Event request list --------------------------------------------*/
00046 
00047 ANALYZE_REQUEST analyze_request[] = {
00048 
00049    {"Trigger",                  /* event name */
00050     1,                          /* event ID */
00051     TRIGGER_ALL,                /* trigger mask */
00052     GET_SOME,                   /* get some events */
00053     "SYSTEM",                   /* event buffer */
00054     TRUE,                       /* enabled */
00055     "", "",
00056     analyze_trigger_event,      /* analyzer routine */
00057     },
00058 
00059    {"Scaler",                   /* equipment name */
00060     2,                          /* event ID */
00061     TRIGGER_ALL,                /* trigger mask */
00062     GET_ALL,                    /* get all events */
00063     "SYSTEM",                   /* event buffer */
00064     TRUE,                       /* enabled */
00065     "", "",
00066     analyze_scaler_event        /* analyzer routine */
00067     },
00068 
00069    {""}
00070 };
00071 
00072 /********************************************************************\
00073               Callback routines for system transitions
00074 
00075   These routines are called whenever a system transition like start/
00076   stop of a run occurs. The routines are called on the following
00077   occations:
00078 
00079   analyzer_init:  When the analyzer program is started. This routine
00080                   should initialize global variables.
00081   
00082   analyzer_exit:  When the analyzer program is shut down. Can be used
00083                   to write final variables etc.
00084 
00085   begin_of_run:   When a new run is started.
00086 
00087   end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run.
00088 
00089   pause_run:      When a run is paused.
00090 
00091   resume_run:     When a run is resumed.
00092 
00093 \********************************************************************/
00094 
00095 /*-- Analyzer Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00096 
00097 INT analyzer_init()
00098 {
00099    return CM_SUCCESS;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /*-- Analyzer Exit -------------------------------------------------*/
00103 
00104 INT analyzer_exit()
00105 {
00106    return CM_SUCCESS;
00107 }
00108 
00109 /*-- Begin of Run --------------------------------------------------*/
00110 
00111 INT ana_begin_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00112 {
00113    return CM_SUCCESS;
00114 }
00115 
00116 /*-- End of Run ----------------------------------------------------*/
00117 
00118 INT ana_end_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00119 {
00120    return CM_SUCCESS;
00121 }
00122 
00123 /*-- Pause Run -----------------------------------------------------*/
00124 
00125 INT ana_pause_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00126 {
00127    return CM_SUCCESS;
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*-- Resuem Run ----------------------------------------------------*/
00131 
00132 INT ana_resume_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00133 {
00134    return CM_SUCCESS;
00135 }
00136 
00137 /*-- Analyzer Loop -------------------------------------------------*/
00138 
00139 INT analyzer_loop()
00140 {
00141    return CM_SUCCESS;
00142 }
00143 
00144 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00145 
00146 /********************************************************************\
00147   
00148   Analyzer routines for different events
00149 
00150 \********************************************************************/
00151 
00152 /*-- Trigger event -------------------------------------------------*/
00153 
00154 INT analyze_trigger_event(char *pevent)
00155 {
00156    if (SERIAL_NUMBER(pevent) % 1000 == 0)
00157       printf("Trigger: %d\r", SERIAL_NUMBER(pevent));
00158 
00159    return CM_SUCCESS;
00160 }
00161 
00162 /*-- Scaler event --------------------------------------------------*/
00163 
00164 INT analyze_scaler_event(char *pevent)
00165 {
00166    printf("\nScaler: %d\n", SERIAL_NUMBER(pevent));
00167 
00168    return CM_SUCCESS;
00169 }
